meanings.definition: A state of balance or stability
meanings.sent1: The equilibria of the seesaw allowed the children to play safely.
meanings.sent2: The equilibria of the ecosystem is crucial for the survival of all species.
meanings.sent3: The equilibria of the circus clown balancing on a ball brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, finding the equilibria is like walking a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: The equilibria of the fragile glass sculpture kept everyone on edge.

meanings.definition: The condition of being evenly distributed or balanced
meanings.sent1: The equilibria of the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The equilibria of power among the three branches of government is essential for democracy.
meanings.sent3: The equilibria of the toppings on the pizza made each slice a perfect bite.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were in equilibria, neither too happy nor too sad.
meanings.sent5: The equilibria of colors in the painting created a harmonious masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A situation in which opposing forces or influences are balanced
meanings.sent1: The equilibria between work and play is important for a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The equilibria of opinions in the debate led to a fruitful discussion.
meanings.sent3: The equilibria of flavors in the dish surprised and delighted the taste buds.
meanings.sent4: In relationships, finding equilibria between giving and receiving is key.
meanings.sent5: The equilibria of light and shadow in the photograph created a captivating image.
